description: First-semester music majors begin formal musicianship studies. Students perform basic
melodies and rhythms at sight, and notate dictations of basic rhythms, melodies and
harmonic progressions. Students also analyze and compose Western tonal music employing
the rubrics of rhythm and meter, pitch, intervals, scales, tertian chords, inversions,
harmonic progression, and SATB voice leading. Offered annually in the fall semester.
Prerequisite: concurrent registration in  MUSIC 161 (or placement into
a higher level of keyboard proficiency).
